* Cross functional internal navigation and leadership engagement with Product, Marketing, Engineering, BizOps teams, etc.

Summary Leo has worked in and around the Online sector for most of his career, primarily in marketing, sales and product development roles, as well as in broader business strategy positions supporting executive management at both startups and fortune 500 companies.  
 
Currently, Leo is the Head of Client Services for the Americas at Yahoo. Previously, he was Vice President of Search Account Management at Yahoo!, leading the North America organization servicing 8,000 clients with $3Billion in annual revenue. Previously, he led the Mid Market Search Sales teams and the Sales Effectiveness team at Yahoo!, responsible for managing the Strategic Partnership with Microsoft for Search Advertising - a 10 year, multi-billion dollar a year relationship.  
 
Prior to joining Yahoo!, he held positions of increasing responsibility in the corporate headquarters of Charles Schwab as an officer and VP, reporting to the President of Schwab Retail Brokerage. During that tenure, Leo led the Corporate Strategy team and managed teams to explore growth opportunities with responsibility for negotiation and operational implementation, and was the key stakeholder representing Schwab retail on numerous product and offering committees. Prior to this exec role, Leo held various Director level positions in Business Strategy, Product Marketing, and Technology Development for Schwab’s Institutional and Corporate Services Enterprises. 
 
Before joining Charles Schwab, Leo worked as Director of Marketing and Product Development for a late-stage startup providing technology solutions to the Mortgage Brokerage and Banking industry. Leo also spent time as a Financial Analyst with Deutsche Alex Brown's Investment Banking Group, focusing on the eCommerce sector.  
 
He holds a BioMedical Engineering Degree from Harvard.
